response.answer_text: Since it’s a formal letter, you have to strictly follow the prescribed format of a formal letter. Firstly, let’s see the letter example and then I will discuss shortly about the format and writing tips.  Some tips to write the letter: Strictly follow the prescribed format of a formal letter to write a job application letter or cover letter.Mention in the letter what good you can bring to the company if you’re being hired and what special skill-set or abilities you have that others may not have it.Write in a brief and precise way. Focus directly to the required skill-sets mentioned in the job description.Pick the matching keywords from the job advertisement and mention as many as possible in the letter.Write the main content of your letter in short paragraphs as far as practicable.Include your name and contact detail with email-id very clearly to get a response from the hiring managerChoose the subject line carefully. It should include your name and the post you’re applying for unless instructed specifically.Mention a clear Call-To-Action (CTA) so that the hiring manager can call you for an interview.Quick notes: Letter length: Letter should be limited within single page.Font size: Use the conventional font like Times New Roman, Arial or Calibri and the size should be between 10 to 12 points.Page format: Use A4 portrait page format with left alignment as a standard.DON’Ts to write the letter: Don’t send common application letter to many companies for different job positions. Personalize the job requirement and customize accordingly.Your resume highlights your detail experience and academic qualifications. So don’t duplicate your resume content in the job application letter or cover letter.Don’t use any emotional or informal words.Remember that a perfect job application letter or cover letter has: Strong openingBody content relevant to the job specificationCustomized job skill-setsClear Call-To-Action (CTA)Finally, here is the format to write the application letter for your quick reference and understanding: [Sender’s address] [Date] [Receiver’s address] [Subject line] [Salutation] Dear Sir/Madam, [Body of the letter] Part-1: Introduction and the reference where you saw the job advertisement Part-2: Your skills and abilities to fit for the job Part-3: Request a call back or an interview [Complimentary closing] Yours Sincerely, [Sender’s signature] [Sender’s name and designation] [Enclosures (1)] Resume

Writing an application for a job of school teacher is always tricky! You have to define yourself in writing such that you will standout in presentation of your skills against other applicants. Well it's not that difficult. But you have to first understand whether you have right qualification & skills requaired to perform duties related to that particular job. I'm sharing few tips with you & with the help of your creativity you can design an attractive application. Consider following points: Give short introduction of yours mentioning your educational qualificationsMention the source/reference from which you came to know about this particular jobState your interests to do this particular jobHighlight your strengths (in short) for carrying out the job related activitiesMention about your past achievements (if any) related to this job profileShow them the versatility related to your skillsAggregating all above points convey them that you are the best choice they haveRequest politely to consider your applicationThank them finally for spending their valuable time for reading out your applicationConclude the application with your name, date, signature & contact number (if applicable)
